intro: Tetranthera areolata, commonly known as the spotted tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, often hairy leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
